info.title: Alien skin
info.summary: Using warped FBM one can create height functions that looks like fluid

info.title: Another star tunnel
info.summary: I grew up with Amiga and Atari ST and star tunnels were an important demo effect at that time so naturally I wanted to recreate the feeling. Inspired by P_Malin's 'Star Tunnel'

info.title: C64 truchet pattern
info.summary: The classic C64 truchet pattern: 10 PRINT CHR$(205.5+RND(1)); : GOTO 10

info.title: Complex atanh math FTW
info.summary: Based on the very cool shader 'Complex Atanh' by mla.

info.title: CRT look
info.summary: Attempting to recreate classic CRT look, one of the first shader created by me for Windows Terminal.

info.title: Dreams of amber
info.summary: Dreams of amber is an impression of amber screens of old.

info.title: Emerald roses
info.summary: Based on the shader '[2TC 15] Voronot' by Trisomie21. In this version using FBM to compute the height function.

info.title: Face in the clouds
info.summary: Using warped FBM to create a face in the clouds that stares into your soul.

info.title: F# in space
info.summary: While not a space shader the twisted F# logos resembles space ships

info.title: F# logo
info.summary: A simple shader featuring the F# logo. F# is a programming language of the ML family. Runs on .NET but also transpiled into JavaScript, Python, Rust and more.

info.title: F# weekly logo
info.summary: Sergey Tihon has been running F# weekly for years. This shader is intended as a 'Thank you for your hard work Sergey'

info.title: Glowing torus
info.summary: Toruses are cool and neat and this based on a popular shader I created.

info.title: Green damask rose
info.summary: Based on the shader '[2TC 15] Voronot' by Trisomie21. I thought the shader looked neat but wondered what would happen if I computed the normal of the height function. This is the result.

info.title: Happy little windows terminal
info.summary: Creating shader sometimes the best results come from 'Happy Accidents' as Bob Ross used to say.

info.title: Wall of hexagons
info.summary: A wall of reflecting hexagons

info.title: Infinite arcs
info.summary: Inspired by CG art that utilizes infinite zooming

info.title: Infinite boxes
info.summary: Result from experimenting with zoom invariant subdividing of 2D space.

info.title: Lonely Batman
info.summary: A simple flat shaded Batman I made based on Z0rg's work.

info.title: Lonely fox
info.summary: A simple flat shaded fox I made when I felt inspired.

info.title: Lost planet
info.summary: A simple shader reproduction of my friend autostrip's work https://www.instagram.com/p/CV-tjLSIgMu/. It was done during Genuary 2022.

info.title: Matrix Maelstrom
info.summary: A failed attempt to recreate the matrix took a lucky turn. Uses bit ops which might be finicky on older cards.

info.title: Memories of green
info.summary: Memories of green is an impression of the hercules screen of old

info.title: Mobius boxes
info.summary: Pink boxes distored by apply mobius transform.

info.title: Neon city
info.summary: Driving towards the neon city and the setting sun.

info.title: Neonwave sunrise
info.summary: Neonwave sunrise is a shader version of art shared by @shreythecray(Twitter)

info.title: Neonwave sunset
info.summary: Neonwave sunset is an attempt to recreate the common neonwave theme of driving along a road into the sunset.

info.title: Nested transparent sphere4
info.summary: A sphere4 is a boxy looking 'sphere'. The normals are nicer than on a normal box and gives nice reflection and refraction effects.

info.title: Night sky
info.summary: A simple  night sky made for a friend.

info.title: Pretty sweet colors
info.summary: I watched a YT for on .NET, didn't remember anything except I thought the colors and shapes were pretty sweet around 0:09 in the video. So improvised a shader around it.

info.title: Recursion
info.summary: An exploration in recursion.

info.title: Sea and moon
info.summary: Bright moon over dark waves. Hopefully works fine on slower machines

info.title: Simple shader
info.summary: A simple shader as a minimal example on how to do a Windows Terminal shader

info.title: Solar system
info.summary: A simple solar system landscape.

info.title: Stars and galaxy
info.summary: Sunrise over an alien planet with a large moon and a distant galaxy.

info.title: Swetugg
info.summary: Swetugg organizes good and affordable conferences in Sweden.

info.title: The Decepticons
info.summary: The Decepticons logo with a metallic finish and red background

info.title: Thindal
info.summary: I liked the twitch streamer Thindal graphics and wanted to create something inspired by it, also borrowed ideas from BigWing's 'The Universe Within'

info.title: WCOM AB
info.summary: I used to work with @devlead and @tobiasandersson at WCOM AB. Created this WCOM shader for them.

info.title: Xor rings
info.summary: I am a big fan of highly saturated glowing colors so naturally I am a big fan of Xor's Cosmic shader.
